CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 8, 1947, pg. 16, reads: "'One World' Foundation - Sincere students of Schenley High School take the long march to receive their diplomas from Principal Bernard J. McCormick in the thirty-second commencement exercise held last Tuesday evening in the School auditorium. Addresses were delivered by several members of the student body including an outstanding talk by Miss Mary Duncan, Fred Mikoleit, president of the Class of 1947 made the key presentation. Miss Marie A. Saul, Associate Superintendent of Pittsburgh Public Schools in Charge of Elementary Education, did the official awarding of diplomas. The Rev. Wilburn C. Campbell, Rector, Church of Ascension, gave the invocation. The general theme of the program was 'The Neighborhood of Schenley.' There were one hundred and seventy-nine graduates from Schenley this year. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Schenley High School graduation ceremony with principal Bernard J. McCormick presenting diplomas on stage
